intro: Eustachya alba, commonly known as the white panicgrass, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, which are typically wind-pollinated. Eustachya alba is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
